pull.title: Appveyor install libevent[thread] vcpkg
pull.body: As per #17586 the default libevent vcpkg install now has thread disabled. This PR installs libevent with the thread feature enabled.

events.body:
ACK (assuming this passes AppVeyor)

Please shorten the commit message though—"As per #17586 the default libevent vcpkg install now has thread disabled. This PR installs libevent with the thread feature enabled." would be better as a commit body than title.

events.message:
Appveyor install libevent[thread] vcpkg

As per #17586 the default libevent vcpkg install now has thread disabled. This PR installs libevent with the thread feature enabled.

issue.title: ci: Add big endian platform - s390x
issue.body:
Discovered this as part of #17402 and a conversation with gmaxwell.

You can see here that the platform is indeed BE: https://travis-ci.org/elichai/bitcoin/jobs/616656410#L36

This closes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6466

issue.title: build: AppVeyor build uses Libevent that built without support for evthread_use_windows_threads()
[libevent] Add thread as default feature
issue.body:
When we disable support `thread` for this port, it will cause some [errors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17586) in Bitcoin Core msvc build.
So I add `thread `as the default feature of `libevent`.

I also updated the deprecated functions.


Related PR #8349.

All features test pass with the following triplets:

- x86-windows

- x64-windows-static

- arm64-windows

- x64-linux

- x64-uwp (not supported)

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.
